meanings.definition: To polish or wax a car to give it a shiny appearance.
meanings.sent1: Dad spent the afternoon simonizing his car to make it sparkle in the sun.
meanings.sent2: I will be simonizing my vehicle before the car show to impress the judges.
meanings.sent3: The car wash employees joked that they were simonizing the cars to make them look like new.
meanings.sent4: She simonized her car with such care that it gleamed like a diamond in the driveway.
meanings.sent5: After simonizing his old car, it looked so shiny that it reflected the clouds above.

meanings.definition: The act of applying a protective coating to a vehicle's exterior.
meanings.sent1: The simonizing of the car's surface helped protect it from scratches and dirt.
meanings.sent2: I learned about simonizing when I saw the auto shop offering it as a service.
meanings.sent3: The simonizing of the cars at the dealership made them look brand new to attract buyers.
meanings.sent4: The simonizing process acted like a shield, guarding the car's paint from damage.
meanings.sent5: The simonizing of the vehicle's exterior was so thorough that it seemed to repel dust.
